question: Where was the ancient Capital of Japan?
answer1: Nara

question: Who was Prince Toyanari Fujiwara?
answer1: a wise State minister

question: What was Prince Toyanari Fujiwara's wife like?
answer1: noble, good, and beautiful

question: What was the couple's one cause for great sorrow?
answer1: No child was born to them.

question: What happened because no child was born to the couple?
answer1: This made them very unhappy.

question: Why did the couple hope for a child?
answer1: gladden their old age, carry on the family name, and keep up the ancestral rites when they were dead

question: Why did the Prince and his lovely wife go to the temple of Hase-no-Kwannon?
answer1: They believed the Mother of Mercy comes to answer the prayers of mortals in the from that they need the most.

question: What did the couple ask for at the temple?
answer1: a child

question: How did the couple feel because they did not have a child?
answer1: sad

question: What happened because Prince Toyonari and his wife prayed at the temple?
answer1: A daughter was born at last to the Princess Murasaki.

question: Why was the child named Hase-Hime?
answer1: She was a gift of the Kwonnon at that place.

question: How did Prince Toyonari and his wife feel when they had a daughter?
answer1: happy

question: What happened when the little girl was five years old?
answer1: Her mother fell dangerously ill.

question: How did Hase-Hime grow up?
answer1: as her mother had wished, a good and obedient little Princess

question: What did Prince Toyonari do after the death of his first wife?
answer1: married again

question: Who was Princess Terute?
answer1: a lady of noble birth

question: What kind of heart did Princess Terute have?
answer1: cruel, bad heart

question: How did Princess Terute treat Hase-Hime?
answer1: unkindly

question: What were Hase-Hime's favorites studies?
answer1: music and poetry

question: Why did Hase-Hime treat her step-mother kindly?
answer1: She had been trained by her own good mother.

question: Why did Lady Terute have no cause for complaint against Hase-Him?
answer1: Hase Hime obeyed her in every way and never gave any trouble.
answer2: Hase Hime waited upon her step-mother kindly.

question: What instrument did Hase-Hime learn?
answer1: the koto

question: What happened because Hase-Hime played so beautifully?
answer1: She and her step-mother were summoned to the Palace to perform before the Emperor.

question: How did the festivities of the Cherry Flowers make the Emperor feel?
answer1: happy

question: What did the Emperor command?
answer1: Princess Hase should perform before him on the koto.
answer2: Princess Terute should accompany her on the flute.

question: Why did the Emperor sit behind a curtain of finely-sliced bamboo and purple tassels?
answer1: No ordinary subject was allowed to look upon his sacred face.

question: How did Hase-Hime astonish her masters?
answer1: her wonderful memory and talent

question: What happened because Princess Terute never took the trouble to practice daily?
answer1: broke down her accompaniment and had to request one of the Court ladies to take her place

question: How did Princess Terute feel because she failed?
answer1: furiously jealous

question: What did the Emperor do because the little Princess played well?
answer1: sent many beautiful gifts to the little Princess

question: What will Princess Terute do because she hates Hase-Hime?
answer1: try to kill Hase-Hime
answer2: try to get rid of Hase-Hime

question: What good fortune did Princess Terute have?
answer1: a son born to her

question: Why did Princess Terute wish Hase-Hime was not there?
answer1: Her son would have all the love of his father.

question: What happened because Princess Terute never learned to control her self?
answer1: She allowed this wicked thought to grow into the awful desire of taking her step-daughter's life.

question: Why did Princess Terute put poison in some wine?
answer1: She wanted to poison Hase-Hime.

question: What were Hase-Hime and her brother doing?
answer1: playing

question: Why did Hase-Hime take the cup of wine?
answer1: She didn't know it was poisoned.
answer2: Her step-mother offered it to her.

question: What happened because Princess Terute grew nervous?
answer1: She poured out the wine hurriedly and unconsciously gave the poisoned cup to her own child.

question: How did the Princess Terute feel when learned she gave the wrong cup to her son?
answer1: angry

question: What happened because Princess Terute lost her child?
answer1: She began to hate Hase-Hime more than ever.
answer2: She eagerly watched for an opportunity to do her harm.

question: How had Hase-Hime become a poetess of some merit?
answer1: She was very diligent.
answer2: She would spend several hours practicing every day.

question: What disturbed the Emperor's rest day and night?
answer1: the roaring of the torrents of water rushing along a narrow bed

question: What did the Imperial Edict command?
answer1: priests to offer up continuous prayers to Heaven to stop the noise of the flood

question: What was whispered in Court circles?
answer1: Princess Hase was the most gifted poetess of the day.

question: What was requested of Princess Hase?
answer1: write a poem and offer it in prayer

question: Why was Hase-Hime afraid when she heard what was required of her?
answer1: Heavy was the duty that was laid on her young shoulders.
answer2: saving the Emperor's life by the merit of her verse

question: How did Hase-Hime feel when she heard the request?
answer1: fear and astonishment

question: What was the poem written on?
answer1: a leaflet of paper heavily flecked with gold-dust

question: What happened after the poem was read?
answer1: The waters ceased their roaring, and the river was quiet.

question: How did the ceasing of the water roar allow the Emperor to recover in his health?
answer1: He could now sleep soundly.
answer2: He would be able to sleep peacefully.
answer3: He would no longer be bothered by the sound of the water.

question: Why was Hase-Hime give the rank of Chinjo?
answer1: She was rewarded for stopping the water.
answer2: She was rewarded for helping the Emperor.

question: How will Hase-Hime's step-mother feel when she hears of Hase-Hime's success?
answer1: angry

question: Why was Hase-Hime's step-mother mortified to see her step-daughter do well?
answer1: brooding over the death of her own child

question: What did Hase-Hime's father do when the step-mother tried to tell him lies?
answer1: told her sharply that she was quite mistaken

question: What did the step-mother do in her husband's absence?
answer1: ordered one of her old servants to take the innocent girl to the Hibari Mountains and kill her there

question: Who was Katoda?
answer1: the step-mother's old servant

question: Why did Katoda defy the step-mother's orders?
answer1: knew that the young Princess was quite innocent of all the things her step-mother had invented to him as reasons for her outrageous orders

question: Who took care of the Princess?
answer1: Katoda

question: What happened because Prince Toyonari thought his daughter had run away?
answer1: He was nearly ill with anxiety.

question: Why did Prince Toyonari call his men together for a hunt?
answer1: to forget his terrible worry

question: Where did Prince Toyonari ride to?
answer1: the district of the Hibari Mountains

question: Who will Prince Toyonari find in the mountains?
answer1: Hase-Hime

question: Why did Prince Toyonari approach the cottage?
answer1: He distinctly heard a beautiful clear voice reading aloud.
answer2: curiosity as to who could be studying so diligently in such a lonely spot

question: How did Hase-Hime feel when she saw her father?
answer1: happy

question: What did Katoda do after bowing?
answer1: poured out the long tale of wrong
answer2: told him all that had happened and how it was that he found his daughter in such a  wild and desolate spot

question: What happened because the step-mother heard what had happened?
answer1: She fled from the house and returned in disgrace to her father's roof and nothing more was heard of her.

question: Who did the little Princess owe her life to?
answer1: Katoda

question: Who was adopted and married to Hase-Hime?
answer1: a younger son of one of the Court nobles

question: Where is there said to be a tapestry sewn from Princess Hase?
answer1: Buddhist temples of Kioto

question: How did Prince Toyonari treat Hase-Hime?
answer1: kindly

question: Why did Princess Terute not like Hase-Hime?
answer1: Princess Terute was envious.
answer3: Hase-Hime was not her real child.
